properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.allow-context-map-all
properties.description: Sets whether the context map should allow access to all details. By default only the message body and headers can be accessed. This option can be enabled for full access to the current Exchange and CamelContext. Doing so impose a potential security risk as this opens access to the full power of CamelContext API.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.allow-template-from-header
properties.description: Whether to allow to use resource template from header or not (default false). Enabling this allows to specify dynamic templates via message header. However this can be seen as a potential security vulnerability if the header is coming from a malicious user, so use this with care.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.argument-file
properties.description: A text file to read more arguments from.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.combined-tag-stats
properties.description: Creates combined statistics based on tags. Use the format tags:title List

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.configuration
properties.description: The configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.robotframework.RobotFrameworkCamelConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.critical-tags
properties.description: Tests that have the given tags are considered critical. List

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.debug-file
properties.description: A debug file that is written during execution.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.document
properties.description: Sets the documentation of the top-level tests suites.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.dryrun
properties.description: Sets dryrun mode on use. In the dry run mode tests are run without executing keywords originating from test libraries. Useful for validating test data syntax.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the robotframework component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.excludes
properties.description: Selects the tests cases by tags. List

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.exit-on-failure
properties.description: Sets robot to stop execution immediately if a critical test fails.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.includes
properties.description: Selects the tests cases by tags. List

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.listener
properties.description: Sets a single listener for monitoring tests execution

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.listeners
properties.description: Sets multiple listeners for monitoring tests execution. Use the format ListenerWithArgs:arg1:arg2 or simply ListenerWithoutArgs List

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.log
properties.description: Sets the path to the generated log file.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.log-level
properties.description: Sets the threshold level for logging.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.log-title
properties.description: Sets a title for the generated tests log.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.metadata
properties.description: Sets free metadata for the top level tests suites. comma seperated list of string resulting as List

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.monitor-colors
properties.description: Using ANSI colors in console. Normally colors work in unixes but not in Windows. Default is 'on'. 'on' - use colors in unixes but not in Windows 'off' - never use colors 'force' - always use colors (also in Windows)

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.monitor-width
properties.description: Width of the monitor output. Default is 78.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.name
properties.description: Sets the name of the top-level tests suites.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.no-status-return-code
properties.description: If true, sets the return code to zero regardless of failures in test cases. Error codes are returned normally.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.non-critical-tags
properties.description: Tests that have the given tags are not critical. List

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.output
properties.description: Sets the path to the generated output file.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.output-directory
properties.description: Configures where generated reports are to be placed.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.randomize
properties.description: Sets the test execution order to be randomized. Valid values are all, suite, and test

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.report
properties.description: Sets the path to the generated report file.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.report-background
properties.description: Sets background colors for the generated report and summary.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.report-title
properties.description: Sets a title for the generated tests report.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.run-empty-suite
properties.description: Executes tests also if the top level test suite is empty. Useful e.g. with --include/--exclude when it is not an error that no test matches the condition.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.run-failed
properties.description: Re-run failed tests, based on output.xml file.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.run-mode
properties.description: Sets the execution mode for this tests run. Note that this setting has been deprecated in Robot Framework 2.8. Use separate dryryn, skipTeardownOnExit, exitOnFailure, and randomize settings instead.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.skip-teardown-on-exit
properties.description: Sets whether the teardowns are skipped if the test execution is prematurely stopped.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.split-outputs
properties.description: Splits output and log files.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.suite-stat-level
properties.description: Defines how many levels to show in the Statistics by Suite table in outputs.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.suites
properties.description: Selects the tests suites by name. List

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.summary-title
properties.description: Sets a title for the generated summary report.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.tag-docs
properties.description: Adds documentation to the specified tags. List

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.tag-stat-excludes
properties.description: Excludes these tags from the Statistics by Tag and Test Details by Tag tables in outputs. List

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.tag-stat-includes
properties.description: Includes only these tags in the Statistics by Tag and Test Details by Tag tables in outputs. List

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.tag-stat-links
properties.description: Adds external links to the Statistics by Tag table in outputs. Use the format pattern:link:title List

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.tags
properties.description: Sets the tags(s) to all executed tests cases. List

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.tests
properties.description: Selects the tests cases by name. List

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.timestamp-outputs
properties.description: Adds a timestamp to all output files.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.variable-files
properties.description: Sets variables using variables files. Use the format path:args List

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.variables
properties.description: Sets individual variables. Use the format name:value List

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.warn-on-skipped-files
properties.description: Show a warning when an invalid file is skipped.

properties.name: camel.component.robotframework.xunit-file
properties.description: Sets the path to the generated XUnit compatible result file, relative to outputDirectory. The file is in xml format. By default, the file name is derived from the testCasesDirectory parameter, replacing blanks in the directory name by underscores.
